meanings.definition: To lift up or raise to a higher position.
meanings.sent1: She used all her strength to uplift the heavy box onto the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The crane was able to uplift the entire car effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's power was to uplift objects with just a touch.
meanings.sent4: The sun's rays seemed to uplift the flowers towards the sky.
meanings.sent5: The balloon's helium helped uplift it into the air with ease.

meanings.definition: To improve or uplift morally, spiritually, or emotionally.
meanings.sent1: Kind words can uplift someone's spirits during tough times.
meanings.sent2: The music had a magical ability to uplift the mood of everyone in the room.
meanings.sent3: The wise words of the old man never failed to uplift the villagers.
meanings.sent4: Her smile had the power to uplift the gloomiest of days.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's encouragement always managed to uplift the students' confidence.

meanings.definition: A feeling of happiness or moral or spiritual improvement.
meanings.sent1: After the community service, she felt an uplift in her heart.
meanings.sent2: The movie's happy ending brought an uplift to everyone's mood.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected compliment gave her an instant uplift in confidence.
meanings.sent4: The sunrise over the mountains filled him with a sense of uplift.
meanings.sent5: The success of the project brought an uplift in morale to the team.
